intro: Pararistolochia deltantha, commonly known as the Delta horseshoe vine, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, horseshoe-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands and along streams. Botanically, it belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae, which includes several genera with similar morphological features.
